item.title: Explosion | Taiwan reveals girl death in Macau
item.description:
Information on the death of the two -year -old girl in Macao was only confirmed by health services (SS), after being revealed firsthand by the media of the former Formosa. SS consider that they have met the “all needs” of the victim and family in a timely manner
The two -year -old girl passed away who had been hit by debris projected by an explosion in Taiwan. Although the death happened on Friday at the Conde São Januário Hospital Center, the information was released on Wednesday night by the Taiwan media. The case dates back to February 13, when a family with seven macao elements was touring Taichung and was hit by several objects projected to the street due to an explosion on the 12th floor of a shopping center. That day, two residents were declared dead, the family grandparents of the family. However, the two -year -old girl, granddaughter of the other deadly victims, stood in a coma, with brain injuries, linked to the machine and fighting for life. The girl was transported to Macao on February 26, always remaining in a coma, and hospitalized at the Conde São Januário Hospital Center. On Friday night, March 7, it died. The information was communicated to Taiwan's media by the man who on the day of the accident helped transport the urgent girl to the hospital. However, death information was not communicated in Macau. The information was only made public, then news has been advanced by the Taiwan media, where the case is still being investigated and promises many developments, because of the need to determine responsibilities about the accident and paid compensation to the victims' families. From the accident, with regard to victims of Macao, four other injuries were resulted in no problem. Behind the injury With the information of Taiwan's social communication agencies to be released on social networks, and reaching some local media agencies, health services ended up issuing a statement at dawn on Thursday in Chinese. The information in Portuguese was only made available in the morning. "Health services reported that, after obtaining the consent of the family, it was now announced that the girl from Macao who was injured in the previous explosion of gas in Taichung died at Conde de S. Januario Hospital on the 7th of this month," was confirmed. The authorities also defended the quality of services provided to the victim and family: “Health services expressed deep regret for the girl's death and presented the deepest condolences to her family, emotional support and care services to family members were also provided and their needs in time,” he was added. Online criticism With the news of the death by Taiwan's communication agencies, several online comments emerged to regret the succeeded and wish the condolences to the family. However, the posture of Macau's government and social communication agencies was also the target of various criticisms, given the misunderstanding of the fact of the outcome of this case, which was highly media, was only known through the Taiwan media organs. In some of the most popular conversation groups of the territory in traditional Chinese, the lack of transparency of the Government of Masters was lamented and the willingness of the media to report events outside the government agenda.

item.title: FUELS | New team to control prices
item.description:
The Power of the People's Association, chaired by Lam Weng Ioi, says that oil -derived products and services are excessive prices in the territory and calls for serious supervision by authorities
The Power of the People's Association defends the creation of a working group to control price fluctuations linked to oil -derived products in Macao. The position was taken by President Lam Weng Ioi, through a letter delivered to the executive headquarters. According to the message released yesterday, the association considers it "evident" that prices need to be regulated because they "keep" always "very high", with an average of over 14 patacas per liter of gasoline, although the price of Crude suffers several fluctuations. From the perspective of the association directed by LAM, the need for supervision becomes even clearer, when the prices practiced are very similar to those charged at other times when the price of oil was much higher. "Increasing prices of these first -need goods is invariably to increase population charges," he is argued. Therefore, the Power of the People's Association suggests a group to “monitor and control the prices” of oil derivatives, and especially those of goods or services with the highest impact on the life of the population, such as the price of fuel, transport, communications and electricity. “Relevant companies must be subject to licensing and supervision,” was nominated. The Association also indicates that companies "exploring public services must be required to disclose prices and limit their profits, and their financial data should be audited and published." "The government should evaluate the prices and operational performance of the companies in question and regularly review licenses, as well as introduce more competitors through regular public tenders," he was added. Eternal struggle Also in the letter the association is insisted on one of its main flags, the control of issuing authorizations for non -resident workers. "According to the complaints of our members, some companies controlled or supervised by public services, such as parking parks or other services subcontracted by public services, are full of non -resident workers, for work such as cleaning, condominium management and even engineering," he was nominated. "We do not support the discrimination of non -resident workers, but the government should take the initiative to encourage these companies to hire more resident workers, especially in the current economic situation," he was stressed. "The priority of local workers in access to employment should not just be an empty slogan," was concluded.

item.title: Macau Pass | Controversial card exchange due to collection
item.description:
After an elderly man complaining about requested 50 patacas to change Macau Pass, the government said that from today there are no charges, after announcing that the exchange was free. As for the request to sign lists for the elections, the executive assured HM that if he is aware of irregularities will end card exchange posts
After a complaint on Monday that an elderly woman was invited to signing a candidacy report for legislative elections when she exchanged the Macau Pass card to the elderly to participate in the great consumption award in a local association, yesterday the process again got to know a new episode. Once again, in the Macao Macao Forum Program of the Radio Macao Chinese channel, an elderly man complained of being charged 50 patacas to change the Macau Pass card to the elderly that allows you to participate in the program for discounts and incentive for consumption consumption consumption. The case occurred in a Macau Pass store where the employee will have informed the resident that he would be exchanged in one of about 60 exchange posts in social services and local associations the service would be free. It is recalled that at the end of last week, the day the card exchange began, the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT) issued a statement informing that “the treatment of replacement formalities” was free. Also the request for a temporary card would have no charges. “If the elderly need to use the card during the replacement period, Macau Pass will provide them with free temporary use card”, even at Macau Pass service centers. After the complaint, DSEDT clarified that the 50 patacas charged would be returned in the balance of the new card. In addition, the government negotiated with Macau Pass to, starting today, finish the pre-ability of fees to change cards. Electoral little leg In addition to the collection of 50 patacas, the exchange of cards and the request of temporary cards that is made exclusively at Macau Pass stores has been criticized by the long lines it has generated. Deputy Pereira Coutinho was one of the voices that denounced the situation. On the other hand, when the card exchange service was only three business days, a resident claimed that his grandmother was invited to sign a candidacy report to legislative elections while trying to change the Macau Pass card to the elderly in a local association. HM contacted all public services involved (Institute of Social Action, Commission on Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly and DSEDT), to find out if any investigation related to electoral actions would be underway during the exchange of the elderly cards, and what the consequences, and only obtained response from DSEDT. The body led by Yau Yun Wah began by mentioning that DSEDT organized training sessions and clarification for "collaborating entities regarding elderly card replacement procedures." In addition, DSEDT said it had elaborated "Operation and Confidentiality Guidelines" and requested "employees of all service posts that fulfilled them rigorously." Regarding the request to sign candidates' propositions during card exchange, DSEDT points out that it has “remembered its employees that they should be conferenceed with residents assistance in replacing cards, limiting only the service available to card replacement”. Communication that DSEDT guaranteed HM, in an email sent late Wednesday afternoon, was reiterated "a few days ago." Regarding possible consequences of electoral use of associations in the work of replacement of cards, the government guaranteed the HM that it will be aware. "DSEDT will continue to supervise all service posts, and if you check the violation of guidelines in any of these, you will immediately cease the card replacement service provided by the service station involved," he was added.

item.title: Economy | Chan u law asks for explanations about health tourism
item.description:
The workers' deputy asks the executive to present the measures he will adopt to foster the health tourism industry, which is seen as one of the pillars of economic diversification
Deputy Lei Chan U wants the government to present the measures that will be adopted to realize the policy of exploitation of health tourism. The question is part of a written interpellation, and comes after the islands hospital has been operating in September last year. According to the deputy, the executive indicated that the way to explore health tourism was the creation of partnerships between the authorities, the concessionaires and the different medical services. However, a legislator linked to the Macau Workers' Federation (Faom) considers that it is necessary to make more information available on what is really intended for the sector and how the objectives will be fulfilled: “What is the point of situation about the use of the Macao Union Medical Medical Center College Hospital as a catalyst to attract more health tourists and promote the development of this sector in Macao?” questions the deputy of the workers. “And what concrete measures were adopted by the government to actually apply these plans?” He adds. According to the understanding of Chan U law, with the Operating Islands Hospital since September 2024 it is necessary to “gradually reinforce its role and its functions in promoting the development of the sector”. Day -hospitals In addition to asking for written interplies that it goes from paper to reality, law Chan U questions the executive about the plans to create the so -called “hospitals of the day”. Initially presented last year, the idea is to create new health facilities in the licensing system, which occupy an intermediate function, between clinics and hospitals. According to the molds presented, and cited by Chan U law, the creation of the new health units implies the alteration of the licensing regime of health institutions. And the government has promised a new public consultation in this regard. However, developments have not yet been found. As such, law asks for a point of the situation: “Administration indicated that it will launch a public consultation about the increase in the number of licenses for hospitals in the first quarter of 2025. What is the point of the situation of the preparatory work of the public consultation? When is the start of public consultation expected? ”, He interrogates. Presented as one of the major health projects in Macao, Hospital das Islands opened last year in September. However, contrary to what was expected is not a public hospital, and management was delivered to a private entity, the Peking Union Medical College Hospital. When they want to use these services, residents have to pay like any tourist or other client. The only way to be cared for equal to those of the public sector happens when residents are referred to this hospital for health services.

item.title: IC | Launched book on the historical roots of Rua das Estlagês
item.description:
“In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Street of Estalagins” is the name of the work Bilingual, launched in digital format, which tells the story of this historic street of Macao, revealing the business that survived the passage of time. Production was in charge of the Macao Artists Society, with the support of the Cultural Institute and Sands China
The history serpes through the stalage street since the end of the nineteenth century. The narrow artery has always been the scene of an intense social and commercial rebolement and it was where Sun Yat-Sen, considered the father of modern China and the Republican Revolution, opened pharmacies and drugstores, especially from 1893. Over the years, Rua das Estalagem, in Porto, was a living example of commerce, and the Portuguese governors were progressively expanding the street, composed of the street Chinese -style buildings and temples, such as the Temple of the Bazaar and Goddess Temple NOVA WO. All these pieces of history are now counting on the digital publication “In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Rua das Estlagês”, a work produced by the Society of Macao Artists and authored by Siguo Chen in Shirley Lule's texts and illustrations. Those responsible for the edition are the Cultural Institute (IC) and the game operator Sands China. According to a press release of Sands China, the book, in Chinese and English, intends to “highlight the fascinating past of the historic Macau Street and the beauty of its legacy”, containing interviews with street -related figures, whether merchants or residents. Thus, it is intended to bring “residents and visitors to rediscover the preciousness of the centenary stores and the cultural heritage of the street through legendary stories” so that they can “widen their understanding of the transformation of the neighborhood and its inhabitants”. The content of the book results from “close conversations with representatives of associations, business entities and residents of the neighborhood,” having dozens of oral stories that can easily be lost if not recorded. This work is not closed in the digital world, having been printed to appear in the public libraries of Macao and schools, in order to “promote the meaning of cultural heritage and enhance mutual ties among the people of Macao”, intending to be “a valuable community resource to deepen the understanding and appreciation of Macao and the street”. 200 years of history One of the highlights given in the book is to the textile sector that has always predominated on Rua das Estlagenas. In the chapter entitled "Two Centuries of Prosperity: Spinning A Legacy in the Textiles Trade" [two centuries of prosperity: the construction of a legacy in the textile trade], it is read that "Street of Estlagins has always been a center for the textile industry." In the years when the textile sector had a larger presence in the territory, between the 70's and 90's, "Rua housed more than 20 stores with factory products, including three spaces from the Veng On Farm Store." “Around 30 businesses related to these stores, such as tailors, clothing stores, western products and funeral ornament stores, which brought a reputation to the street,” he reads. In Rua das Estlagenas “Tissue trade is over 200 years old,” says the same text. Other chapters of the book speak of the presence of the republican revolutionary in Macao in “The Starting Point of Sun Yat-Sen’s Story” [The Starting Point of the story of Sun Yat-Sen] or stories of street-linked personalities and their commerce. In the conclusion of the work, it refers that after the transition, the street "faced new challenges: the global financial crisis, the SARS epidemic, the COVID-19, and the uncertainty of the economy, leaving the need for renewal again." “In the past, businesses flourished by themselves thanks to hard work and resilience. But nowadays the community joins with a shared view, actively planning [the development of the street] with the support of the Macao government and the integrated resort companies. With these efforts, there is a sense of hope that Rua das Estlagês briefly recovers its ancient vitality, being ready for a new era of prosperity, ”is pointed out. Institutional view IC President Deland Leong Wai Man pointed out that the book results from the “weighted effort to widen the discussion around preservation and revitalization [of the street],” according to the same press release. "Street renewal is expected to inspire more people to learn about the historic neighborhoods of Macao and participate in their preservation, combining ideas and resources to ensure that the city's culture and history continue to prosper during generations," he said. In turn, Wilfred Wong, CEO of Sands China, argued that "Street of Estalagues is a microcosm of Macao itself, a place where a rich story meets a modern future." “The walls of their alleys witnessed the transformation of Macao, and their stories and people deserve to be remembered, as they are precious sources of Macao's cultural heritage. Our effort to publish the book was possible thanks to the collaboration of our local team to conduct interviews with owners of historic stores, create illustrations and take photographs, among other works, ”he said. New facades It is recalled that this publication arises after the Government was announced by the Sands performance at the Rua das Estalagens Revitalization Plan, namely with the “Entrepreneurs Recruitment Program for Rua das Estlagês”, launched in April last year. The game operator explains that the seven businesses selected for the initiative “have been opening through phases, bringing energy to the zone along with other new businesses, providing a platform for young ambitious entrepreneurs to realize their dreams”. In addition, the game operator intends to revitalize stores' façades “with drawings that enhance their characteristics, resonating the history of the street and the city”. For this initiative, Sands has also collaborated with the Macao Artist Society, and the drawings will be created by two young local artists, Chek On Law and Sit Kat Kit. "The aim is that, with a collective effort like this, the community can rediscover the history of the street and learn about its past stories and stores through the visual interpretations of these local artists from Macao and their perceptions of the territory," he reads. Siguo Chen, the book's author, is a veteran journalist with a career of over 60 years who has been deeply linked to the media area in Macau and Hong Kong.

item.title: Lisbon | First skate park opens this Saturday
item.description: The Lisboeta Macau venture inaugurates tomorrow the first macao outdoor skate park, in partnership with the General Association of Macao Skate Sports Culture and Sports Development. The idea is to "promote the practice of skateboarding and improve its culture." The park is located at the H853 Outdoor Event Space and will be managed by this association, starting the operation, still experimental, from Saturday. According to a statement, this space is intended to become a "privileged destination for radical sports enthusiasts, further enriching Macao's sports and leisure offers." It is understood that this initiative, linked to radical sports, “aligns with Macao's strategy vision of Turismo + Sports, promoting synergies between cultural tourism and various experiences”, and reinforces “Macao's appeal as a dynamic and multifaceted destination”. The entity that will manage this park is a collective of four associations, namely the Macao Skate Development Association, the Macao Skate Exchange and Learning Association and the Macao Skate Association. With this inauguration, it is expected to "develop the practice of skateboarding and its growth, involving more enthusiasts of Macao," in order to "bring joy to Macao, whether the skateboard is a sport or a form of cultural expression."

item.title: Teaching / AI | Courses in Beijing's primary and secondary schools later this year
item.description: Since the second half of 2025, all Beijing primary and secondary schools will offer general artificial intelligence courses (AI) with a workload of at least 8 hours a year, according to the Plan for Promotion of Artificial Intelligence Education in Primary and Secondary Schools (2025-2027), recently released by the Municipal Beijing Education Commission, the People's Diary indicates. The curriculum will cover all stages of education, from elementary school to high school, and aims to strengthen students' abilities in this key area. Schools will have the flexibility to create AI autonomous courses or combine them with other subjects, such as information technology, science, practical activities and work education, adds the publication. In addition, under the program, the Chinese capital plans to train one hundred specialized teachers and a thousand prominent specialized teachers in AI teaching. The initiative is part of Beijing's broader effort to accelerate the construction of an IA educational system with characteristics of the capital and, at the same time, promote the reform and development of basic education. Focusing on six key areas of AI application, including teaching, learning, promotion, evaluation, research and administration, the city will explore new AI application scenarios. This ambitious plan puts Beijing as a pioneer in the integration of AI in education, to prepare students to navigate the digital world while using technology responsibly.

item.title: Flora Garden | Ice rink completed this month
item.description: The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has revealed that the construction works of an ice rink for children in the garden of Flora will be completed this month. The revelation was made during a colloquium on community matters in the parish of São Lázaro, on Wednesday. According to the newspaper or Mun, AMI representatives explained that before being an ice rink, the place was a maze with plants. As this space was damaged by the sun and heavy rains, while other buildings prevented the construction of shelters for the vegetation, AMI decided to install a 450 square meter ice rink. The AMI representatives also explained that in the current phase they are still correcting some defects in the works and that at a later stage, when safety is guaranteed, the track will be open to the public.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO

item.title: Sun Yat-Sen | Marked centenary of the death of the “father of modern China”
item.description:
Sun Yat-Sen died on March 12, 1925. Unavoidable figure in the political history of modern China and the father of the movement that led to the fall of the imperial regime, Sun Yat-Sen was celebrated yesterday in Guangzhou, where he was born, Beijing and Taiwan
The first president of China post-imperial and considered the father of the country's modern era, Sun Yat-Sen, was remembered yesterday in mainland China and Taiwan, the 100th anniversary of his death. In Beijing, there was a “brief and solemn ceremony” of honor to Sun in Beijing Park that has its name. Authorities and “people from all the sectors of society” were present, kept silence and made three venias in front of their statue, the Xinhua official news agency said. The Chinese Academy of History praised the political figure in his Weibo account, describing him as "a great national hero, a great patriot and a major precursor of the Democratic Revolution of China." The city of Guangzhou, the capital of Guangdong Province, where Sun Yat-Sen was born, inaugurated on Tuesday an exhibition of old objects related to the man who was one of the promoters of the revolution that overthrew the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911). The Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Building in the city welcomed the first performance of a musical based on the revolutionary's youth. In Guangzhou, where there is also a university named Sun Yat-Sen, this exhibition is exhibited, which includes objects such as the Sun Yat-Sen Graduation Exam report at the College of Medicine for Chinese, in Hong Kong, from 1892. The certificate of marriage between Sun Yat-Sen and Soong Ching-Ling is also highlighted in 1915, a woman later, woman later, Vice-President of China during the government of Mao Tse-Tung, embracing communism. In the same exhibition you can also see the bronze bust of Sun Yat-Sem itself, made by order of the Japanese friend Umeya Shokichi in 1929. The "father" of modern China was also remembered in Taiwan, with a ceremony by the Sun Yat-sen memorial in Taipei, where flowers were deposited and express respect. Double memories Despite founding, in 1919, the Kuomitang, which would become the main rival of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP), Sun is remembered in both mainland China and Taiwan. The Board of State's Taiwan Cabinet stated that Sun Yat-Sen “sought China's national unity and revitalization throughout his life,” appealing at the same time to the “compatriots of Taiwan to join us in the inheritance of his legacy” and to “oppose secession” of the island. Born in 1866, Sun studied medicine in Hong Kong - then a British colony - and, after leading several revolts, gained notoriety as a revolutionary leader and as a driving force of an attempt to modernize the country. In 1911, the Xinhai Revolution led to the fall of the Qing and Sun Yat-Sen dynasty was appointed provisional president of the New Republic of China in January 1912, but quickly gave power to the country's main military leader, Yuan Shikai, who, far from consolidating republican ideals, dissolved the parliament in 1914 and proclaimed herself in 1915, annulling Grande, annul Part of the democratic progress by which Sun had fought. From then on, he continued to promote his ideal of a unified and republican China, reorganizing the KMT and seeking international support for his cause. In 1923, he established an alliance with the newly founded CCP and received the support of the Soviet Union to reinforce the political movement. However, he failed to consolidate a stable government before his death in 1925. A LIFE OF FIGHT In the work “Sisters Soong-the oldest, younger and redest,” by Jung Chang, some details of Sun Yat-Sen's life are described before embracing the revolutionary cause and the way he left his parents' house in Guangzhou, looking for a better life. The place of destination was Hawaii, which on July 4, 1894 declared itself as a Republic, an event that, according to the book, "helped shape today's China." “A 27-year-old radical Chinese, Sun Yat-sen, landed in the archipelago and entered a world where the word 'republic' was in every mouth,” he is described. In China, the agitation against the power of the empire became strong. The Republic "was a new concept," for "the monarchy was the only political system that China knew." "At the time, the country was governed by the Manchu dynasty," the Manchus "were not natural from China, but they had conquered the territory in the mid -seventeenth century." “Since they did not get more than one percent of the population, they were considered a minority of foreign rulers and had never lacking opposition from the native rebels Han. Sun was one of them, ”he describes himself in the same work. Sun Yat-Sen was "a low, dark man with well-proposed and pleasant traits." Its home village, Cuiheng, had soils inappropriate for agriculture, which provided “a life of extreme misery” to those who lived there. As such, the revolutionary's family did not escape adverse conditions. In his first escape from the context of poverty, Sun went to Hong Kong, finding shelter to the diocesan school and boys orphanage, then accepted a marriage arranged by the family as a gimmick to return to the village. Sun Yat-Sen married Mu-Zhen, had children, but was an absent figure and something carefree in the face of family responsibilities, traveling the world to seek support for the revolution he wanted for China. Jung Chang's work describes how Sun's course linked to the "three sisters," Ei-Ling, May-Ling and Ching-Ling. Charlie Soong funded and supported Sun Yat-Sen in her revolutionary causes, one of her daughters, Ei-Ling, became the republican secretary. This, although married, had made attempts to approach loving and EI-Ling, but eventually had a relationship with Ching-Ling, who was nationalist, but later embraced communism, being known as the "red sister." Ching-ling was also known as the Madame Sun Yat-Sen, but at the time of Sun Yat-Sen's death, the relationship between them had cooled. After the establishment of the Popular Republic of China, Ching-Ling was vice president of the country, between 1949 and 1954, and then between 1959 and 1975, and was vice president of the Permanent Commission of the National Assembly. Passage through macau Moreover, Sun Yat-Sen's life crossed Macao several times, where he lived a short time, unlike his woman, Mu-Zhen, and the children who remained in the territory longer. To remember the short period in which the Republican lived in the territory, at the time under Portuguese administration, the memorial house of dr. Sun Yat-Sen, where he "witnesses the short but significant stay in Macao in the early twentieth century when, running away from the power of imperial mandarins, tried to move his supporters forces in order to implement a new regime in China." “In Macau received support from some friends who were illustrious and influential figures of social and political life at the time,” reads the description of the museum. Another interesting detail of the 1911 Republican Revolution is the proximity of dates against the establishment of the Republic in Portugal, which took place on October 5, 1910.
